Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the speaker's role in building the last nuclear plant in the country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the speaker built the last nuclear plant in the country.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the speaker's involvement in building a nuclear plant in New Jersey equates to building the last nuclear plant in the country.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the speaker may have misunderstood or misinterpreted the information received from the expert at the nuclear conference.
